net.xuset.objectIO.connections

Class FileCon

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.StreamCon
      • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.FileCon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection, StreamConI, MsgParsable

    public class FileCon
extends StreamCon
    Connection that can be used to send and receive MarkupMsg to and from a file. Sending a message writes the contents of the message to file, and the file is read to receive a message. Buffered streams are used for I/O. Calling flush() is sometimes needed before data is actually written to the disk.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileCon

        public FileCon(java.lang.String filePath,
       long id)
        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Constructs a FileCon object. This constructor calls the FileCon(File, id) constructor after it creates the file object.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to the file
        id - the id of the connection
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file is not found

      • FileCon

        public FileCon(java.io.File file,
       long id)
        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Constructs a FileCon object. The I/O streams are created using the specified file. The I/O streams are buffered streams.
        Parameters:
        file - specifies the file for the connection to use
        id - the id of the connection
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file is not found

    • Method Detail

      • openFile

        public static FileCon openFile(java.io.File file,
               long id)
        Creates a new FileCon object for the given file and id. This method differs in the FileCon constructors in that it does not throw a FileNotFoundException. If the file is not found an IllegalArgumentException is thrown instead.
        Parameters:
        file - used for constructing the FileCon object
        id - the id of the connection
        Returns:
        the newly created FileCon object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file is null or does not exist.
